snippet: Although global energy markets establish the national trend for oil and gasoline prices, many factors are much more local — including the proximity of refineries to crude oil sources.
abstract: Jeff Sommer Strategies column observes that, although global energy markets establish the national trend for oil and gasoline prices, many factors are much more local--including the proximity of refineries to crude oil sources; contends in the United States, a combination of infrastructure constraints and legal impediments makes it very likely that regional price disparities will widen in coming weeks.
lead_paragraph: Although global energy markets establish the national trend for oil and gasoline prices, many factors are much more local — including the proximity of refineries to crude oil sources.

headline.print_headline: Gas Price Disparity Seems Here to Stay
headline.seo: Gasoline Price Disparity Seems Here to Stay - Strategies
headline.main: Gas Price Disparity Seems Here to Stay
